title: Like Caledonia, AMPHOTO book, short descenders
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317153024im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bodbocaled_4665.jpg)

Saw this typeface in an old AMPHOTO book. I feel I should know what it is, but I don't. It looks a lot like Caledonia, but it's less distinctive, leaning a bit towards Century Expanded. Also, it has very short descenders.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317153024im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bold_sam_5519.jpg)

Here's the bold face, as that may be helpful.
author: quadibloc

comments.content:
It may well be Caledonia. Looking at V&M's _The Type Specimen Book_, the six and seven point sizes of Linotype Caledonia had very small descenders, while the larger sizes, even eight point, had the more generous descenders with which I am familiar.

The book in question was set in a smaller size than is usual for books, presumably so that it could be a small volume and economical despite being printed on glossy paper.
